intro: Microlicia subsetosa, commonly known as the slender microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, simple leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens, typical of the Malvaceae family. Microlicia subsetosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
